metadata.description:
In 1911, one of the greatest works of art in history, the Mona Lisa, was stolen from the Louvre Museum in Paris by a petty thief named Vincenzo Perugia, and later this painting was seen in the list of his possessions. But how could such a person, who was not even a professional, steal this work from the Louvre Museum? This work was created based on the story of the theft of this work of art.
Size 6724x4263 Pixels.
